lines.text:
[to Adelina and Andrea as she's watching TV]
It's a shame that men like Bogart always end up falling for the first two cent broad they meet, and most of the time she's blonde.
Old people are not nice people. The lack of energy makes them mean.
You see, we're all in the same boat, and we slowly pull towards a dark and incomprehensible delirium.

Dear Adelina, I don't want to tap into your private life. I'm a lonely woman too like Giovanna is now unfortunately. Yet it's never crossed her mind or mine when we became widows to look for a man, just to have a male figure at home.

You're widows, and I'm not - and do you know why you're widows? Because you never gave a damn about men. I find them funny. I like to have them around me, and they feel this, so that;s why they like me! Hmmph!

[to Adelina]
Ours is a doomed love. Men oppose it and nature as well.

[Giving Adelina her dentures]
Here. this way, when he'll kill you, it will be a little like he was kissing me.
